metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5754 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - critical.
metadata.Description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis of the data cache. Jann Horn discovered that microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized memory reads via sidechannel attacks. This flaw is known as Meltdown. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information, including kernel memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Variant 3, aka Meltdown This flaw only affects Intel processors. AMD reports that their processors are not affected. The break-fix lines for this CVE are not complete since a large number of patches are required to mitigate this issue. The commit(s) listed are chosen as placeholders for automated CVE triage purposes. ppc64el and s390x kernels were fixed with the following commits: aa8a5e0062ac940f7659394f4817c948dc8c0667> local-2017-5754-ppc64el d768bd892fc8f066cd3aa000eb1867bcf32db0ee> local-2017-5754-s390x Unfortunately, the automated CVE triage tooling gets confused since the commits identified by the local-* placeholders were reverted in favor of the upstream commits so they're not included in the break-fix section below.

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-108.131').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1047.56').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-euclid package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9021.22').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1006.9').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was pending').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1015.20').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1015.16').

linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-108.131').
